intro: Hieracium submuticum, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in open woodlands. Hieracium submuticum is a native species in Europe and parts of Asia, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
